Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation; multiple employees  backgrounds were listed active who is no longer associated with your operation after 7 day of leaving.
All children in care stated that a staff member yells when the children are in trouble.
Correction Narrative: I, Brittany Gilcrest RCCR, contacted Dr. Lewis to reminder her of the comply by date of 11-9-2021. Dr. Lewis stated that she was not sure what response she wanted to give to the concern but will send it by the due date of 11-9-21. As of 11-10-2021 I have not received a response, as of now Sound Decision is not actively operating, there are no staff nor are there children placed in their care. With no active staff or children at the operation Sound Decision is currently able to follow to standard.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that a staff member violated a condition of her background check.
Correction Narrative: I received the following follow up from Dr. Lewis on 7.22.2021 "This has already been corrected. Additional staff has been hired to ensure that Sound Decisions follows the conditions specified. In the future when we receive a background check that is provisional or with conditions, the CBU representative will be contacted to better understand those conditions to ensure they are adhered to."

Deficiency Narrative: Two broken chairs were removed during the inspection.
Two of 4 bathrooms were not equipped with toilet paper and hand towels. This was corrected during inspection.
The downstairs kitchen did not have hot running water. There was no work order provided.
Correction Narrative: During a follow up inspection there is now hot water in the kitchens and bathrooms.

Deficiency Narrative: Food was not in plastic(sugar and cereal). It was not covered or plastic bags. Boxes were not closed. This was corrected during the inspection.
A caregiver has been working at the operation, having access to children in care, for two weeks without an initial background check.
Correction Narrative: I received an email from the operation 7.22.2021 stating "This has already been submitted yesterday and addressed. The background check is pending. The staff was removed from the schedule until background check was completed returned. The schedule and documentation was provided on 7/20/21."

Deficiency Narrative: It was concluded that a staff at the operation interfered with child in care from making a phone call to the Hotline.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed stating "LCCA will ensure that all clients are allowed to use the phone to call the Hotline when needed. The staff have been retrained on Child Rights"

Deficiency Narrative: A serious incident report did not provided details that occurred including what led up to the altercation, police involvement and the child eloping from the operation.
Correction Narrative: LCCA will ensure that all staff completely documents serious incidents and will review the document before filing and sending it out. The staff have been retrained on Documenting and reporting. An upcoming training is scheduled September 1. 2021.

Deficiency Narrative: Conditions on a background check for one staff member were not being followed as required.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing children's records.  One child's medication log was found in another child's record.
Correction Narrative: The operation is currently closed. There are no children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: One child did not receive their prescribed psychotropic medication for 27 days.
Correction Narrative: The operation is currently closed. There are no children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: In review of medication logs there were inconsistencies with the daily pill count documented.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation  stating "LCCA will ensure all staff received adequate trying prior to the administration of any medication. Staff receives training through three sources including but not limited to (Bemaj Pharmacy, DFPS training, and SD Medication Training). When staff makes medication errors, retraining will be conducted followed by a posttest addressing the issue noted in the medication error. LCCA or nurse will complete a weekly medication audit as well as random medication audits to verify accuracy and efficiency. Policy was updated." The operations medication training and medication policy was also provide.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide a copy of the child's preliminary service plan as requested.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation stating "LCCA reviews all service plans and collaborates with the client case manager to ensure the inclusion of all required information as well as completion of all required signatures. In the event signatures are not received from service team members outside of the organization, documentation will be included to display attempts. Staff changes have been made to address this issue." The operations medication training and medication policy was also provide.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care did not receive prescribed medication for three days as a result of the operation misplacing the prescription.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation stating "LCCA will ensure all medication is in the correct location. Medication is in the Pharmacy Closet and each locked drawer is labeled with the specifics of what is stored. During the weekly medication audits, medication location will be verified. Staff is required to initial in print after reading all medication notes. Any new prescriptions will be received and logged. Policy was updated." The operations medication training and medication policy was also provide.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children and two staff, including the Administrator expressed concern with unfair treatment.
Correction Narrative: The operation is currently not operating and does not have any children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that there was a search conducted without any documentation.
Correction Narrative: LCCA will ensure that all staff complete search documentation as no later than 2 hours of the search. All search will be documented and placed in the clients file.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that the medication log did not reflected the dosage based on the prescription.
Correction Narrative: LCCA will ensure that all medication records are filled out on the form. In the event needed, missing information will be requested, and a medication error form completed if needed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was unsupervised long enough to cut and dye her hair without staff being aware
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed stated "LCCA will ensure that all staff is monitoring clients closely and no more than 20 minutes will past without adequate supervision. Retraining was provided in this area."

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that documentation was not provided upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through a hole was being covered by an inadequate material and can cause injury to a child. The well shed on the property was also observed to still be unlocked and accessible to children and presents a safety hazard. Also observed in the backyard was a broken piece of PVC pipe sticking out of the ground. Pictures were taken of the inadequate material covering the hole, the unlocked shed, and the broken PVC pipe.
Correction Narrative: The well hole on the side of the home was covered by a sturdy cover. The well shed was locked, and the PVC pipe was cut down to prevent potential harm to children in care.

A concrete hole was also observed on the side of the building. Pictures were taken of the large hole in the ground in the shed and of the hole on the side of the operation.  
After being provided two additional weeks time past the Compliance date, the operation failed to provide the necessary Corrective Action for this deficiency.
Correction Narrative:
The operation placed a cover over the hole in the ground, but it consisted of an inadequate material and broke with little pressure. The door to the well shed still remained unlocked.
5/6/2021- The operation build a study cover for the well hole on the side of the building. The Well shed was locked and the PVC pipe was cut to prevent potential harm to children.
